alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Northern Baltimore (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 12 at 9:43PM EDT until September 13 at 2:45AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northern Maryland, including the following areas, in north central Maryland, Carroll. In northern Maryland, Northern Baltimore. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and possible thunderstorms late tonight into Wednesday morning will be capable of producing intense rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour which may result in flooding of small streams and creeks. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
